posts.post_content:
I hate this card. I hate it for *precisely* the same reason I hate [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel).  
  
A 4/4 for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)? Okay, we have a [stone golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=stone golem). Solid, but only for limited.  
It's a living weapon? That makes it a fair amount more powerful and versatile, even though it's equip cost is ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol). +4/+4 to a creature for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol) is pretty good, and can win games.  
  
If we stop there, we have a moderately well costed card. Since it's stronger than most uncommons, it would be about a weak rare. But, I will agree that it's a little boring. So why not add a keyword?  
Vigilance? Alright. A vigilant 4/4 for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol) isn't game breaking, and equipping it to a creature can make for a tricky situation, but I'm not hating this card. This would be a solid rare.  
  
Returning to the hand for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)? I understand. This is the powerful ability to push it to mythic. A living weapon that can be recast, or bounced to protect itself? That's pretty crazy, and it's already a lot stronger than most c... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
As of July 1, 2011, [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) and the reason why Batterskull was so good, [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic), will be banned in Standard. Those who see this card in a later day and age will think "Wow, look at how good this card is! For only *five* mana?!" And then they'll see all of the links to the Mystic. Two mana, 4/4 vigilant lifelinkers ruled the land for a short time.   
  
Will this card ever see Standard play without its tutoring, cost-reducing friend tossing it out for three mana cheaper? Doubtful, but we'll see what the new Standard brings in four months.  
  
EDIT: It's been a month since our friends were banned, and Caw-Blade STILL dominates the format, even without this bounce-able fatty and its banned BBFs (BBBFs?). I'm really disappointed in WotC about the Standard state.  
  
Anyway, I didn't talk so much about the card itself when I first wrote this comment, so I will now. Aaron Forsythe, the **Random Card Comment of the Day**... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Two mana, 4/4 vigilant lifelinkers ruled the land for a short time.

Will this card ever see Standard play without its tutoring, cost-reducing friend tossing it out for three mana cheaper? Doubtful, but we'll see what the new Standard brings in four months.

EDIT: It's been a month since our friends were banned, and Caw-Blade STILL dominates the format, even without this bounce-able fatty and its banned BBFs (BBBFs?). I'm really disappointed in WotC about the Standard state.

Anyway, I didn't talk so much about the card itself when I first wrote this comment, so I will now. Aaron Forsythe, the Random Card Comment of the Day... (see all)

posts.post_content:
I really don't get the flavor behind this. It shows something like a battering ram charging at some dudes, tossing them into the air. So what abilities does it grant, trample and haste? Wait, vigilance? What part of a battering ram is vigilant? After it knocks down the front door of their castle, it runs back to defend you during the counterattack? Whaaaat? And I'm not even going to try and decipher the lifelink.  
  
This card is a flavor trainwreck.

posts.post_content:
Thanks for gunking up Legacy for the summer of 2011.  
  
It won't surprise me when [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic) receives a Legacy banhammer. There are Top 16 Legacy tournament placements now consisting almost entirely of (a) "Stoneblade" Stoneforge Mystic + Batterskull + Sword of X and Y combos and (b) Natural Order race decks that are hyper-specifically designed to pound Stoneblade with Progenitus.

I hate this card. I hate it for *precisely* the same reason I hate [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel).  
  
A 4/4 for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)? Okay, we have a [stone golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=stone golem). Solid, but only for limited.  
It's a living weapon? That makes it a fair amount more powerful and versatile, even though it's equip cost is ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol). +4/+4 to a creature for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol) is pretty good, and can win games.  
  
If we stop there, we have a moderately well costed card. Since it's stronger than most uncommons, it would be about a weak rare. But, I will agree that it's a little boring. So why not add a keyword?  
Vigilance? Alright. A vigilant 4/4 for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol) isn't game breaking, and equipping it to a creature can make for a tricky situation, but I'm not hating this card. This would be a solid rare.  
  
Returning to the hand for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)? I understand. This is the powerful ability to push it to mythic. This is one of the most pathetic excuses for a mythic rare I have ever seen.

posts.post_content: Ok, 4,5 stars minus 4 for the art... just joking, it's an incredible non-[doom blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doom blade)able card (since it's a living weapon) and lives enough to make a pseudo BS out of a [llanowar elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=llanowar elves) (yes, since mrs stoneforge got banned, this card is nice in green). Why green? 1st, it's a good easy to play pseudo-black monster in a green deck. 2nd, even without doom blade, if it's removed, it's also easy to equip. 3rd, if your opponent face this card before i don't know a green [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Stomper) beatdown card, he wil be doubtfull if sidedecking cards like [Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shatter).

posts.post_content:
ppl...its magic...its steals lifewith magic, it walks by magic...the form is really not important. Since it seems to be huge and can be used as a weapon by a faerie it oviously must have sizealtering and quite likely form altering magic as well as animation and lifesteal. simple. whenever you have trouble understanding how a card works in the real world just remember...its magic...  
  
and its great. good that its 5 mana making it tricky to find a spot without a little ramp/stall. had it been 4 and fx 3/4 or 3/3 it would show up much too often^^
